definition: spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: Models know their feet are in for a tough time during the shows.
sentences.chinese: 模特们都知道展示会期间他们的脚惨不忍睹。

sentences.english: We could see only his face because of his injuries.
sentences.chinese: 我只能看着他的脸，他身上的伤惨不忍睹。
上个月就更是惨不忍睹了。

sentences.english: The once, seem to be miserable, eventually internecine.
sentences.chinese: 那个曾经，似乎惨不忍睹，最终两败俱伤。

sentences.english: The overall design of this camera is obnoxiously hard to describe.
sentences.chinese: 整个设计根本就是惨不忍睹。

sentences.english: But in his first season, the team is terrible and management fires him.
sentences.chinese: 谁知第一球季，球队的表现惨不忍睹，他因而被辞退。

sentences.english: The location was pretty good, but aside from that it was aweful.
sentences.chinese: 它的位置相当不错，但是其他的就惨不忍睹了。

sentences.english: Her face is almost as ugly as your mug.
sentences.chinese: 那张脸真是惨不忍睹，跟你有一拼了。

sentences.english: Yet when Katrina struck, the execution of that plan was abysmal .
sentences.chinese: 然而卡崔娜来袭时，计画的执行却是惨不忍睹。

sentences.english: Human vibrant homes, Zhuanshun between appalling.
sentences.chinese: 人类生机勃勃的家园，转瞬之间惨不忍睹。

sentences.english: It's painful to watch, especially knowing that liberation is only a few simple steps away.
sentences.chinese: 令人惨不忍睹，尤其当知道解放仅仅数步之遥。

definition: muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition
to be underwhelmed/to be less than impressed
